title: rame is not defined
body:
With jade@0.15.1:

```
a#test-post-btn Test POST
#print-dialog
  iframe.preview(scrolling='no')
```

I'm getting following error:

```
ReferenceError: /Users/don/dev/xxxx/views/test.jade:9
    7| a#test-post-btn Test POST
    8| #print-dialog
  > 9|   iframe.preview(scrolling='no')

rame is not defined
    at anonymous (eval at <anonymous> (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/jade/lib/jade.js:162:8))
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/jade/lib/jade.js:167:12)
    at ServerResponse._render (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/express/lib/view.js:422:21)
    at ServerResponse.render (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/express/lib/view.js:315:17)
    at /Users/don/dev/xxxx/app/router-default.coffee:22:18
    at callbacks (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/express/lib/router/index.js:272:11)
    at param (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/express/lib/router/index.js:246:11)
    at pass (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/express/lib/router/index.js:253:5)
    at Router._dispatch (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/express/lib/router/index.js:280:4)
    at Object.handle (/Users/don/dev/xxxx/node_modules/express/lib/router/index.js:45:10)
```

Likely due to parser getting confused by tag name starting with keyword `if`.

Today seems to be Bug Day. :-)
